Molly Gordon is a rising star in Hollywood, having recently been cast in the second season of the FX series "The Bear". She plays Claire, the love interest of the show's lead character, Carmy. Gordon is also co-writing and co-directing her first feature film, "Theater Camp". She is the daughter of two Hollywood directors, and has been acting since she was a toddler. Gordon is described as charming and disarming, and her character Claire is a human woman, not just a sweet girl. She is ambitious and candid, and Gordon is grateful for the opportunity to play such a complex character. Gordon is aware of the internet's power, but is undaunted by the challenge of playing the new girlfriend of the internet's boyfriend.

  1. Molly Gordon is a wry and sprightly actress who stars in Season 2 of the FX series “The Bear”.
  2. Gordon is also co-writing and co-directing her first feature film, “Theater Camp”.
  3. Gordon plays Claire, an emergency room resident and love interest for the jittery chef Carmy in “The Bear”.
  4. Gordon is the daughter of the director Bryan Gordon and the writer and director Jessie Nelson.
  5. Gordon began acting as a toddler and has been described as “charming and disarming” and “not the girl next door”.

"Molly Gordon is like a diamond in the rough; with her wry humor, sprightly attitude, and charming disposition, she shines brightly in her roles, from the jittery chef's love interest to her first feature film as co-writer and co-director. Her talent"
